article.headline: Sam Houston St. 68, SE Louisiana 64
article.story: HAMMOND, La. (AP) -- Chris Jordan scored 21 points and Sam Houston State got another 23 from its bench as the Bearkats defeated Southeastern Louisiana 68-64 Wednesday night. Jordan was 8-of-11 from the field, hit two 3-pointers and was 3-of-7 from the free-throw line. Jejuan Plair added 12 points for Sam Houston State (13-5, 4-2 Southland). Terry Bryant led the Lions (8-10, 2-5) with 19 points. Ricky Woods and Joseph Polite added 12 each and Quennell Green had 11. Woods also pulled down 12 rebounds. Southeastern Louisiana was ahead 32-26 at the half, but the Bearkats battled back to take the lead in the second, outscoring the Lions 42-32.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
